At that time, the bodhisattva universally observes with the eye of wisdom all the wholesome roots, which are immeasurable and boundless.

When cultivating those wholesome roots, whether seeking conditions, gathering resources, purifying, entering, striving, practicing, penetrating, examining, or revealing, all of these have various gates, various realms, various characteristics, various events, various aspects, various practices, various names, various distinctions, various origins, and various cultivations. All the wholesome roots therein are established by the mind that is directed towards the vehicle of the ten powers, and are all dedicated to omniscience, being one and not two.
He dedicates all the wholesome roots in this way, namely:
'May I attain the perfect unobstructed physical actions and cultivate the practices of a bodhisattva;
I vow to attain pure and unobstructed speech in order to cultivate bodhisattva practices;
I vow to attain unobstructed mental activity and abide in the Great Vehicle;
I vow to perfect an unobstructed mind and purely cultivate all bodhisattva practices;
I vow to give rise to immeasurable vast generosity and provide for all sentient beings without limit;
I vow to attain mastery of the mind with regard to all dharmas and expound the great Dharma-illumination without obstruction;
I vow to attain clear understanding of all the realms of omniscience, give rise to the mind of enlightenment, and universally illuminate the world;
I vow to always correctly recollect the buddhas of the three times and contemplate the TathÄgata always present before me;

Vow to dwell in all worlds without fatigue, teaching and transforming beings without ever resting;
Vow to give rise to immeasurable wisdom and skillful means, accomplishing the inconceivable path of the bodhisattvas;
Vow to attain the wisdom of non-delusion in all directions, able to discern all worlds;
Vow to attain the power of wisdom of sovereign spiritual penetrations, able to adorn and purify all lands in a single thought;
Vow to attain universal entry into the intrinsic nature of all dharmas, seeing all worlds as completely pure;

'May all sentient beings forever leave behind all the destinies of hell, animals, and the realm of Yama;

In order to cause all sentient beings' minds to be unshakable and unobstructed.

Having seen these things, with skillful wisdom they diligently cultivate and give rise to immeasurable supreme and wonderful merits. For the sake of sentient beings, they diligently seek wholesome dharmas, their minds are free from negligence, and they extensively gather various wholesome dharmas;

Just like the great ocean, with inexhaustible wholesome dharmas universally covering everything, they become the basis for various wholesome dharmas, and with the skillful dedication of wholesome roots, they are without discrimination;

They reveal immeasurable various roots of goodness, their wisdom always observes all sentient beings, their minds always recollect the realm of roots of goodness, and they dedicate roots of goodness equally to sentient beings, without rest.

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas dedicate these wholesome roots in the following way:
They do not cling to the world and do not grasp at sentient beings;

They accord with all the equal and correct teachings, do not destroy the true characteristics of the TathÄgata, and equally contemplate the three times without the characteristics of sentient beings;

Although they skillfully cultivate right practices, they know the nature of karma is empty, understand that all dharmas are like magical transformations, and know that all dharmas have no intrinsic nature of their own;

They eliminate all causes and conditions of attachment, know the principle of suchness, contemplate the nature of all dharmas as being completely extinguished, understand that all dharmas are of the same true characteristic, and know that the characteristics of all dharmas are not in conflict with each other;
